performance_metrics.name: Orchestration Latency (Average)
performance_metrics.description: The average time taken for the SOAR platform to initiate and execute an orchestrated workflow. Measured from event receipt to workflow activation.

performance_metrics.name: Automation Success Rate
performance_metrics.description: The percentage of automated workflows that successfully complete without manual intervention.  Factors in workflow design, data quality, and system integration.

performance_metrics.name: Incident Resolution Time (Average)
performance_metrics.description: The average time taken to resolve a security incident using the SOAR platform.  Includes detection, investigation, and remediation stages.

performance_metrics.name: Workflow Throughput (Events/Second)
performance_metrics.description: The number of security events the platform can process and manage concurrently. Dependent on event volume and complexity.

performance_metrics.name: API Response Time
performance_metrics.description: The response time of APIs used by the SOAR platform for integration with other security tools.

performance_metrics.name: Scalability (Concurrent Users)
performance_metrics.description: The number of simultaneous users who can access and utilize the SOAR platform without performance degradation.

implementation_requirements.name: SIEM Integration
implementation_requirements.specification: API integration with a SIEM platform (e.g., Splunk, QRadar, Sentinel) supporting at least 10,000 concurrent events per second.
implementation_requirements.description: Seamless ingestion of security alerts and events from the SIEM.

implementation_requirements.name: SOE Integration
implementation_requirements.specification: API integration with Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) systems.
implementation_requirements.description: Enable correlation of data between the SOAR platform and the SIEM.

implementation_requirements.name: Threat Intelligence Feed Integration
implementation_requirements.specification: Support for at least 3 major threat intelligence feeds (e.g., MISP, Recorded Future, VirusTotal) with automated enrichment capabilities.
implementation_requirements.description: Real-time threat intelligence data to enhance detection and response.

implementation_requirements.name: Playbook Management
implementation_requirements.specification: Version control, workflow automation, and user-defined playbooks for common incident response scenarios.
implementation_requirements.description: Predefined workflows for standardized response actions.

implementation_requirements.name: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
implementation_requirements.specification: Granular control over user permissions and access to workflows and data based on roles.

implementation_requirements.name: Reporting and Analytics
implementation_requirements.specification: Real-time dashboards and customizable reports for key security metrics and incident trends.

implementation_requirements.name: API Gateway
implementation_requirements.specification: Integration with API gateway (e.g. Kong, Apigee) for management and security of API endpoints.

operational_considerations: Regular Playbook Testing and Updates: Conduct quarterly testing of playbooks and update them based on evolving threats.
Data Quality Management: Implement processes to ensure the accuracy and completeness of data ingested into the SOAR platform.
Automation Skillset Development: Train security analysts on automation concepts and SOAR platform usage.
Monitoring and Alerting: Configure comprehensive monitoring and alerting to detect performance issues or system failures.
Change Management: Establish a robust change management process for any modifications to the SOAR platform or integrated systems.
Integration Complexity: Plan for potential challenges during the integration phase with other security tools. Detailed mapping of data flows is crucial.
